contents.title: Data Structure
contents.description: Commands are represented as an array of Command objects. A Command object must at least have an id and a label property. Here is an example:

children.value: Commands are represented as an array of
object must at least have an

props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
const commands: Command[] = [
  {
    id: '1',
    label: 'Command 1',
  },
  {
    id: '2',
    label: 'Command 2',
  },
  {
    id: '3',
    label: 'Command 3',
  },
]
  
  const selectedCommand = ref<Command | null>(null)
</script>

<template>
  <CmdBar :groups="[{key: 'people', commands: 'people'}]">
    <template #header>
      <CmdBar.Input placeholder="search fo anything" />
    </template>
    <template #content>
      <CmdBar.List :config="listConfig" @selected="selectedCommand = $event">
          {{ command.label }}
      </CmdBar.List>
    </template>
  </CmdBar>
</template>

children.value: Commands are always grouped. You can define your groups by providing an array of
object must at least have a

props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
const groups: Group[] = [
  {
    key: 'people',
    commands: [
      {
        id: '1',
        label: 'Command 1',
      },
      {
        id: '2',
        label: 'Command 2',
      },
      {
        id: '3',
        label: 'Command 3',
      },
    ],
  },
  {
    key: 'places',
    commands: [
      {
        id: '4',
        label: 'Command 4',
      },
      {
        id: '5',
        label: 'Command 5',
      },
      {
        id: '6',
        label: 'Command 6',
      },
    ],
  }
]
</script>

<template>
<CmdBar :groups="groups">
    <template #header>
      <CmdBar.Input placeholder="search fo anything" />
    </template>
    <template #content>
      <CmdBar.List :config="listConfig">
        <template #default="{ command }">
            {{ command.label }}
        </template>
      </CmdBar.List>
    </template>
  </CmdBar>
</template>

contents.title: Layouts
contents.description: Docus provides multiple built-in layouts for displaying your Markdown pages.

children.value: Docus provides multiple built-in layouts for displaying your Markdown pages.
The default layout for every page created in the project. This layout renders multiple section alongside the content:

props.code:
---
aside: true
bottom: true
toc: false
---

Your awesome content

children.value: Current page is live sample of default layout.
layout is content focused layout. This layout does not render aside menu of table of contents.
This layout accept some configuration from content front-matter.
in content front-matter the content will be rendered in full width.
: Using this option you can modify layout container look. Like constraining layout width of changing the background.
in front-matter will add horizontal padding in the layout.

props.code:
---
title: Home
layout: page
fluid: true
---
